name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Confederates built an explicitly white-supremacist, pro-slavery, and antidemocratic nation-state, dedicated to the principle that all men are not created equal," @smccurry3 writes: https://t.co/6aclozGIzQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The unexpected turning point in Dave Grohl’s relationship with his father came with a furious runaway note Grohl wrote in 1985. "My father was my first, and best, reader. It was through him that I found my love of writing...as a rebellious teen." https://t.co/eCDQrahrcz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "You can’t really blame the guy for feeling terminally frustrated throughout my adolescent years. I’ve had feral pets that were easier to tame than me in my prepubescence." 

-- From Dave Grohl's Father's Day essay (via @TheAtlantic):
https://t.co/i8NcF7mPtg

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Really, they serve to keep out the interloper—but I am the interloper.” https://t.co/9kcBKz9lir

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "You go out to a bar with friends this week, and you’re planning to visit your elderly relatives in a few days. You feel healthy, and you even get a COVID-19 test out of caution. The result comes back negative. Is it safe to go?" -- From @sarahzhang:
https://t.co/1MaiM1LUGo

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Sweet and funny Dave Grohl essay about his relationship with his dad https://t.co/JOQXez7jxW

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: It turns out Oklahomans might care more about their own health than the president does: https://t.co/bSAe9H24hR

name: TheAtlantic
text: Unfortunately, a negative COVID-19 test is still not a free pass, reports @sarahzhang: https://t.co/ma80EAO3dY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The attorney general’s apparent goal is to turn the Department of Justice into an arm of the president’s personal interests," argues @RosenzweigP: https://t.co/paGnSgnz5Z

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Seek to encapsulate Florida in a single narrative, and you’ll find yourself thwarted,” writes @legroff. “We find our motley self-portrait composed of stories that shift like sand underfoot.” https://t.co/RfmzzbmiJ6

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rooting out third-degree racism is what will ultimately change the narrative about race, @MLTJohnRice writes. https://t.co/qTvOfjDi03

name: TheAtlantic
text: As companies publicly grapple with their shortcomings on diversity, Elon Musk, the CEO of SpaceX and Tesla, is missing the mark, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/LhG0QOZxrh

name: TheAtlantic
text: A few glimpses of Iowa’s landscape, and some of the animals and people calling it home—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/h1WgGyxyg6

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Iowa: Images of the Hawkeye State - the 24th in a year-long photo series, focusing on each of the 50 states in the United States of America https://t.co/gDEdjoYrjM https://t.co/92WwpbQjai

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Rooting out third-degree racism is what will ultimately change the narrative about race." @MLTJohnRice on civil rights, momentum, and what American institutions should do next. https://t.co/aPP8mb3VqR

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Ah, Florida. A state for those drawn to "peril and con-artistry... built on promises of an eternal present, on blithe and deliberate disregard for the past so as not to have to learn from it." And who better to write about it than @legroff: https://t.co/bkPkjSucEd

name: TheAtlantic
text:
“That old canard about Ponce de León finding Florida while looking for the fountain of youth? It’s a lie.”

@legroff reports on the true story of Florida: https://t.co/r0Cg2xGID8

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Touchy" -- A poem by Elizabeth Bradfield: "we say, when someone’s / sensitive. So touchy. So / dangerous and delicate and / ready to tip. Touching, / though, is sweet." https://t.co/xkEEgX1kra

name: TheAtlantic
text: Many are crediting K-Pop fans and TikTok teens for the lower-than-expected turnout at Trump’s Tulsa rally. @kait_tiffany looks at how fan accounts organize in support of causes before celebrities they love even say a word. https://t.co/mNcNsM8SD6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The country was treated to a stunning sight: The president of the United States imitating a caricature of the president of the United States as he is defined by a relentlessly hostile press corps," Andrew Ferguson writes: https://t.co/Y04Y3PuyEP

name: TheAtlantic
text: “To try to understand this most incomprehensible state, we need varied and probing narratives, ones that change as Florida changes and are told by people who love the state too deeply to refrain from blistering criticism,” @legroff writes. https://t.co/W2JNh1huR1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Four years of Donald Trump is an emergency, George Packer writes. Eight years is a permanent condition. A look at the president’s war on American institutions: https://t.co/7cQz8oDyxP

name: TheAtlantic
text: Readers respond to recent stories in @theatlantic magazine: https://t.co/pUfi2j5dv8

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Most voters are basing their assessments of Trump’s performance less on their actual daily experiences and more on their preexisting viewpoints about his tumultuous and norm-shattering presidency," @RonBrownstein writes. https://t.co/12wHIHr4Aj
